SENT.plain: Protein-losing enteropathy (PLE) is characterized by gastrointestinal loss of serum protein
It is usually caused by hypersecretion from a tumor, ulcer, or long standing lymphangiectasia
However, we report a 47-year-old man of peritoneal nodal follicular lymphoma who developed PLE with none of them
Oozing of whitish fluid from duodenal bulbar mucosa was endoscopically seen, resulting in continuous loss of protein
Chemotherapy was effective and PLE was rapidly diminished
Nodal lymphoma lesion was considered to disturb lymphatic flow and to regurgitate it to duodenal mucosa
To our knowledge, this is the second report of a lymphoma patient presenting PLE without a gastrointestinal mucosal lesion
